lexUnit.name: flicker.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to reflect light off of or from an object intermittenly

sentence.text: The latter 's lower lip stuck out and her eyes flickered .
His black eyes flickered , and he drew the monk over by his sleeve to look at the pageant more closely .
The young people were draped about the furniture or lay in couples on the floor in utter silence whilst the firelight flickered .
Shadows fled into every corner of the poky little room as the flame flickered , shrank , a knife of burning air in the damp room .
The tall hard-faced woman stood by the fire , watching the small flames flicker on the dying coals , and then , with a deliberate effort of will , she dismissed the thoughts and memories .
The flames would flicker on the glass of the brass-framed pictures , enlivening the theatrical characters , making everything cosy .
She looked away a moment , noticing how the fire 's light flickered in the window pane ; how it cast a mottled , ever-changing pattern against the narrow opening .
The electric light flickered and dimmed .
The little light flickered .
In the distance lightning flickered .
Lightning flickered noiselessly in the western sky .
He wetted his lips in a theatrical way and a glimmer of humour flickered in his eyes .
Anger flickered in his eyes .
Amusement flickered briefly in his obsidian eyes .
The answerphone flickers red from the centre of the carpet ; hesitantly I push the button .
She moved to the stairs and stood for a moment in the silence of the hallway , the candle flickering in her hand .
Benjamin pointed to the fire flickering in the great hearth .
In spite of a complicated lighting system , only one candle flickered in an antique silver candlestick .
A candle flickers on the table in front of Neneh .
Jailed shadows flickered on the walls .
The fire flickered about the walls of the room , but the wind was howling outside , lashing snow against the window and darkening the afternoon .
The candle flickered again , so badly that it almost flickered out .
On clear nights these same skies held us spellbound as Northern Lights flickered eerily and changed colour like some celestial cinema curtain .
Behind her the door crashed open , flung against the wall with a force that rattled the windows and sent the candles flickering wildly .
` Oh , shoot , " said Sally-Anne disgustedly when the candle flickered and almost went out -- again .
